intro: Pentacalia shaferi, commonly known as the Shafer's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas. It has slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
